body:
Currently, calling the `graph` command with ASCII output fails:

```
$ spack graph netcdf
Traceback (most recent call last):
  ...
  File "spack/lib/spack/spack/graph.py", line 105, in topological_sort
    for dep in children(node).values():
AttributeError: 'list' object has no attribute 'values'
```

This PR fixes the ASCII output and also corrects two typos found in the `Spec` and `DependencyMap` classes.
title: Fix graph command with ASCII output
